questionText: John is trying to sketch a design for his website. What are the things John must do when sketching his design?
answerOptions: John will not be able to show the transition in sketching
John needs to spend more time doing the sketching
John should set a fixed time of the day and duration to perform the sketch
John can make a complex sketch then you can modify them for the final product
correctAnswer: John will not be able to show the transition in sketching

questionText: What is the suitable statement about empathize of design thinking phases?
answerOptions: Brainstorm many possible solutions
Priorities the core functions and synthesize them
Discuss about the overall design with the user
Identify the requirements exactly and sort in order to priority
correctAnswer: Identify the requirements exactly and sort in order to priority

questionText: Design thinking some times visualized as a linear process, bt it is actually:?
answerOptions: Incremental and recursive
Iterative and recursive
Sequential and recursive
Iterative and incremental

questionText: Which one is not an cognitive process?
answerOptions: Attention
Memory
Perception
Argueing

questionText: Which of the following is not a user interface design process?
answerOptions: User, task, and environment analysis and modeling
Interface design
Knowledgeable, frequent users
Interface validation

questionText: A college is redesigning its website Current students are the main users of the website Which one of the below elements should definitely be on the website?
answerOptions: College rules and regulations
Information on faculty members
Information about courses
Alumni details

questionText: Design Thinking typically helps in _______?
answerOptions: Innovation
Data Analytics
Financial Planning
Operational Efficiency

questionText: Which one of the following best describes 'ethnography'?
answerOptions: Research about different ethnic groups
Early childhood research
Experimental research
Naturalistic research

questionText: Which of these is NOT part of the anthropological perspective?
answerOptions: Ethnocentrism
Cross-cultural study
Holism
Cultural relativism

questionText: Which of the following is not a type of user interface?
answerOptions: Command language based
Menu based
Efficiency based
Direct manipulation based

questionText: Compared with users who skip a mobile-app walk through tutorial, users who sit through the tutorial will?
answerOptions: Be faster to perform a task within the app
Be less likely to successfully complete a task within the app
Perceive a task within the app as more difficult
Enjoy the app more
correctAnswer: Perceive a task within the app as more difficult

questionText: Which of the following accordion signifier is most likely to signal to users that the accordion will open in place rather than leading to a new page?
answerOptions: A plus
A right arrow
A caret (downward-facing arrow)
No icon at all

questionText: Which of the following is an example of Campbell's law?
answerOptions: Airbnb hosts begging customers for high ratings
Shoppers with niche needs making up for a high aggregated sales volume
Small number of web pages accumulating most page views
The tendency of most webpage layouts to follow golden-ratio proportions
correctAnswer: Airbnb hosts begging customers for high ratings

questionText: User interface design begins with?
answerOptions: Identification of user, task, and environmental requirements
User scenarios are created and analyzed to define a set of interface objects and actions
It creates a screen layout that depicts graphical design
All of the mentioned above

questionText: What is the user interface analysis and design?
answerOptions: It's a process of system implementation
It is an overall process for analyzing and designing a user interface
It's a process of system testing
None of the mentioned above
correctAnswer: It is an overall process for analyzing and designing a user interface

questionText: An Interface analysis focuses on?
answerOptions: The profile of the users who will interact with the system
Skill level, business understanding, and general receptiveness to the new system
For each user category, requirements are elicited
All of the mentioned above

questionText: What is grounding?
answerOptions: The process of establishing common ground with a communication partner or a work team
The process of collecting user data on which to base design
The process of getting the user calm and comfortable at the beginning of a user test
The process of connecting with users to build empathy
correctAnswer: The process of establishing common ground with a communication partner or a work team

questionText: What are workflows good for?
answerOptions: Show layouts for pages that have static content
Indicate the flow of an interaction without overwhelming the reader with the details of page layouts
Document complex interactions on pages with a lot of dynamic content
Document complex interactions on sites with many discrete, relatively static pages
correctAnswer: Document complex interactions on pages with a lot of dynamic content

questionText: Which of the following is true of hamburger menus?
answerOptions: The overwhelming majority of users have no idea what the hamburger icon stands for
Hamburger menus tend to work better on the desktop than on mobile
Users find the navigation faster when it is placed in a hamburger menu than when it is displayed in a visible navigation bar
When navigation is placed inside a hamburger menu, users are less likely to use it than when it is displayed in a visible navigation bar
correctAnswer: When navigation is placed inside a hamburger menu, users are less likely to use it than when it is displayed in a visible navigation bar

questionText: What is the best practice for logging in and registration on E-commerce websites?
answerOptions: Ask users to log in or create an account if they do not have one; do not offer a guest checkout option, but explain the benefits of registration
Allow users to check out as guests
Ask users to log in or create an account if they do not have one; do not offer a guest checkout option
Allow users to check out as guests and offer the option to register at the end of the checkout
correctAnswer: Allow users to check out as guests and offer the option to register at the end of the checkout
